title: Behind charred bodies in Bengal, rags to riches, nexus of crime and TMC politics - The Indian Express
content:
1. Behind charred bodies in Bengal, rags to riches, nexus of crime and TMC politics  The Indian Express
  2. Birbhum Killings: Mamata Banerjee Visits Violence-Hit Bengal Village  NDTV
  3. Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee visits Birbhum village, gets TMC neta arrested  Times of India
  4. Opposition leaders make a beeline for violence-hit Birbhum village  The Indian Express
  5. Birbhum Violence: Buck Stops with Mamata, This is Political, Administrative Failure  News18
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: At its centre is Bhadu Sheikh, the 38-year-old TMC deputy pradhan of Barsal Gram Panchayat, a resident of Bagtui village, whose murder set off the retaliatory killing in which eight persons, including six women and a child, were charred to death, all relatives of one of his associates he had fallen out with.
